intro: Mabea angustifolia var. longifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf mabea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in summer. Native to the southeastern United States, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sun. Its fibrous roots and hairy stems are adapted to its wetland or swampy habitats. The plant is often found in wetland ecosystems and is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological importance.
